name: Porkchop Adlai Fried Rice
description: Delight your taste buds with this Porkchop Adlai Fried Rice recipe, a perfect blend of high-protein, high-fiber, and incredibly flavorful ingredients for a healthier twist on the classic. Ideal for those seeking healthy yet hearty dishes.

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Adlai Rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the Adlai Rice according to package instructions until tender, then set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Chop the porkchop, eggplant, cherry tomatoes, red onion, red pepper, green capsicum, and carrots into bite-sized pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Shred the tinapang bangus (smoked milkfish) into small flakes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pan, heat some oil over medium heat and saut√© the red onion until translucent, about 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Add the porkchop pieces to the pan and cook until browned on all sides, about 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Mix in the eggplant, cherry tomatoes, red and green peppers, and carrots, and cook until they start to soften, about 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in the cooked Adlai Rice, shredded tinapang bangus, and season according to taste. Cook together for another 5 minutes to let the flavors meld.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 8
